headline: Billionaire Charlie Munger Said 'Damn Right' I Am Rich Owning 3 Stocks—Because 'Hell, One Will Suffice' If You're Not A 'Know-Nothing Investor'
summary: Charlie Munger didn't need 50 stocks, a team of analysts, or a color-coded pie chart to feel rich. He needed three picks—and maybe not even that many. At the 2017 Daily Journal annual meeting, Munger laid it out with signature bluntness: "The Mungers have three stocks. We have a block of Berkshire, we have a block of Costco, we have a block of Li Lu's Fund, and the rest is dribs and drabs." Then he posed the question himself: "So am I comfortable?
